website_summaries.verdict: Nice performance level at low price. Holds up well to rough treatment of the hardware. A good entry-level rangefinder.
pros: Durable design survives tough course conditions
Lightweight model fits in a pocket
Ships w/carrying case for easy transport
cons: Can take a long time to dial in the distance
Sometimes struggles with providing accurate distance

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive unit!
customer_reviews.text: Although skeptical at first, after having owned 2 other rangefinders that were substantially more expensive and from respected companies, after using the Tec Tec Tec unit several times now, I have to say that I am impressed with its performance. The VPRO500 is somewhat larger than my previous model and the all-plastic exterior doesn't immediately communicate high quality, but the proof lies in its quick acquisition of target, immediate indication of precise range, and otherwise high functional performance. I'm quite happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: cryptic

customer_reviews.title: Great Product That Gets Used Weekly
customer_reviews.text: I received my VPRO500 ahead of the scheduled delivery date and it was nicely packed. The 6X optics are fantastic. I had a problem locking onto the flag stick, but the owner and customer support were very helpful. They pointed out to me the correct use of the Mode button. VERY important. Make sure you click the Mode button so that you see the Flag icon in the bottom left of the view finder. After that, it locks on flawlessly. I am very satisfied with my purchase and have compared it to the more expensive Bushnell, and I would recommend the VPRO to anyone who wants a terrific product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: Both my friend and I own this. We both found it frustrating to get accurate readings. My readings would be so far off that I would have to shoot multiple obstacles to verify the distance of the flag. I've owned this for 6 months now and it can no longer take any measurements. I've tried • Replacing the battery • Removing the battery >> hold the buttons down to discharge any residual power >> installed the battery • Tried shooting multiple objects (no reading) The only time I get a reading is if I shoot my foot and i get '07 yds" for my reading. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Weeman

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product and received it yesterday, tried to use it today. The unit would not provided accurate information. Example my GPS showed center of green 125yd, the laser unit 1168yd! another example; the GPS showed 206yd and the laser showed 106yd. This inaccuracy was consistent and different each time I tried, the unit never showed the correct yardage. I tried repeatedly at every shot and never got consistent information. Many time the unit would show a blank or just dashes. When I got home, called TecTecTec at 3:30pm on a Tuesday and they were closed. Really! So I decided to return the unity back.
customer_reviews.author: MikeL

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't work.  Doesn't even come close to working.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible waste of money. Consistency (and inconsistency, to make matters even worse) inaccurate by 30-40 yards, from any distance. Has to be the worst range finder on the market. I highly recommend spending a few more dollars and getting a decent range finder, not a worthless piece of junk like this one. And shame on Amazon for making this horrible device an 'Amazon's Choice' product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best customer service I have encountered on Amazon. I had challenges with one of the features on the product and mentioned it in the review. The were very responsive and very interested in me having the product I wanted. They are the ones who reached out to me to make it right as well as ensure I was using the rangefinder properly. This resulted in me, not a direction reader, using it for more consistent ranges. Basically, my experience was that there is little to no risk in giving this a try. If you don't like it, they will do all they can to make it right. Their customer service certainly gets a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work well for me. I emailed the manufacturer about returning it for a refund and they gave me instructions and tips. I gave it another go, wanted to be fair. Still didn’t work consistently. Contacted them again but said sorry, your return time has passed. But we’ll send you some breathing tips so you can hold it steadier. I’m not a sniper, I just was a consistent distance to the pin on the green. Save your money, don’t purchase this one unless your hands are steady as rocks.
customer_reviews.author: TG2

customer_reviews.title: Found this here with great reviews and decided to ask Santa to bring me ...
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted one of these but refuse to pay the expensive price for the popular brands on the market. Found this here with great reviews and decided to ask Santa to bring me one this past Xmas since I been a good boy. I been using my buddies range finder also in the picture which cost over $150 more than the Tec VPRO500 and they do the exact same thing. Very happy with my gift and looking forward to a great year of reaching the flag more often. Great buy for an amazing price, so if your thinking about it pull the trigger and get it. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Quintina Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I do not know if I got a bad unit or not but it is going back tomorrow. Used today on the course for the second time and it continually fails to recognize anything past about 50 yards. My playing partner had a Nikon and we compared the two. His registered trees, the pin, the bunker, the foursome ahead of us, and mine just kept returning a "does not compute" icon. Very frustrating. Had the third player test this unit to see if I was crazy and he also said it did make any useful readings. I have had this for about 10 days but it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce G.

customer_reviews.title: wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Looks great; packaged nicely, tech support is awesome. Unfortunately, neither myself or any of my golf buddies could get my VPRO500 to read consistently. TecTecTec techies (!) gave me some tips, yet range-to-target was wildly inconsistent regardless of the mode utilized. Thinking I had purchased a bum unit I replaced it but we experienced the same result across several rounds/different courses. My buddie's rangefinder (a different brand) worked just fine, but the VPRO500 simply didn't get the job done. I don't understand all the 5-star reviews; maybe I somehow received two defective units, but not likely.
customer_reviews.author: tmac

customer_reviews.title: A fine range finder
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems fine. The one small problem is that the shut off time from after locating a distance seems a bit too long, running down the battery long term. This unit replaces a range finder which is almost identical to this and it had this same problem but a lot longer shut off time (perhaps from a sticky button).
customer_reviews.author: R.A. CARLSON

customer_reviews.title: The TecTec Tec VPRO500 was just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the TecTecTec VPRO500 Range Finder. The cost was affordable and It is very accurate for checking distance in yards. I purchased this range finder about 2 months ago and I have not had any issues with it. I set a target at 300 yards and and 1 foot. I checked it with the range finder and the distance is in yards so it showed 300 yards. I then set a distance of 300 yards and 2 feet and the range finder showed 301 yards. I found the distance to be satisfactory and accurate for target shooting with my rifle. I would buy this VPRO500 Range Finder again and I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Dayz

customer_reviews.title: COMPANY WILL NOT TAKE CARE OF ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I PURCHASE THIS UNIT 13 MONTHS AGO WITH A FREE 2 YEAR REPLACEMENT WARRANTY. UNIT HAS STARTED BEING OFF AROUND 16-20 YARDS 2 MONTHS AGO. REPLACED BATTERIES AND WENT THROUGH ALL TROUBLE SHOOTING STEPS. CUSTOMER SERVICE NUMBER IS DISCONNECTED. I ONLY RECIEVE SYSTEM GENERATED EMAIL RESPONSES FROM COMPANY. THE UNIT WAS GOOD FOR ABOUT A YEAR AND THEN ISSUES STARTED HAPPENING. THE REAL PROBLEM HERE IS THE COMPANY. THEY WILL NOT HELP YOU WHAT SO EVER!! PLEASE CONSIDER ANOTHER PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS EASILY IF DROPPED
customer_reviews.text: The product works great, as long as you never drop it. I bought this rang finder for the 2nd time after I realized it wasn't properly reading distances after I dropped the original one that I purchased. The 2nd one I owned, I dropped it once again on the golf course, from not very high (about waist high or a little more), and quickly realized it could no longer provide an accurate distance. Save a little more money, and buy Bushnell, unless you are certain that you will never drop your range finder.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.  Great Company To Work With.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and seems to be very accurate. I especially like the scanning function where you can move it and get constant measurements as you zero in on the target. Company is incredibly helpful too. I highly recommend this product and the company.
customer_reviews.author: Stanton D. Allaben

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not great
customer_reviews.text: Of all the range finders I have owned, this is the worst. It works OK to the pin, but I have lots of trouble picking up anything else on the course. Lately, it has been missing pins about 25% of the time. I guess is just does not like the reflectors some pins have. I give 3 stars for the price, but I would not buy this again. I'd spend a few more $$ for one of the main brands that seem to work better. If $ is an issue, this is OK but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: worked well for a year
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed using this easy-to-use rangefinder on the course as it seems quick to post the yardage (faster than other brands). However, right after the 1 year mark - I've noticed it takes multiple tries to "hit" the pin and even recently - I couldn't even "tag" some pins that were less than 200 yards away. Disappointing after remembering how effective it was early on. I've reached out to customer service to see if they will honor their warranty. Def would like a rangefinder to work well for more than a year...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Good rangefinder. Fantastic Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good rangefinder. It is fast, accurate, easy to use, and with clearly superior optics. The only thing missing is the “jolt” confirmation of focus on the flagstick, which is available on some other models - which cost twice as much. “Jolt” is unnecessary on this unit because of the clarity of the visual presentation - and “jolt” erodes battery life. I’m very pleased with the unit. But I’m completely blown away by TecTecTec’s incredibly responsive customer service. Incomparable, in my experience. Try it; you’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rutlander

customer_reviews.title: 18 month review
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the VPRO500 Rangefinder in Dec of 2018 and the unit performed perfect. A couple of months ago I noticed a slight rattle,something seemed to be loose in the unit but It still performed accurately. Then after about a month of use the rattle got worse and I was unable to range the flag. I noticed the bottom lens was loose. I notified TecTecTec customer care and a couple of emails later they replaced my rangefinder. The customer care staff was prompt and easy to work with. I would recommend purchasing any of TecTecTec's products.
customer_reviews.author: TJsGracieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly functional and good rangefinder for golf. Great for the money. Finding and locking in on the pin takes a little practice and you need to use common sense a bit to make sure you’re number is correct. I’ve used other lasers that are a bit easier including better feedback when you lock on the pin (vibration) but you’ll pay more. So decide how important that feature is to you. But the TecTecTec Device will absolutely give you the number.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this to work. My Busnell V2 finally ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to work. My Busnell V2 finally died after 5 years. Unfortunately this unit couldn't pick up a flagstick regardless of the mode. Maybe it was defective, but it was totally inaccurate and untrustworthy. If someone else had a rangefinder and told me the distance, I could eventually find that number, but it took 10 seconds of seeing all sorts of other distances displayed. I returned it and bought a Bushnell V4.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy & Louis Bon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to target the flag
customer_reviews.text: My course has many trees and the pin seeker mode was ineffective because there are trees behind every green. In the other modes, I had great difficulty catching the pin. I have a Leopold that has an issue with the display over 200 yards because the first number is not complete. That is why I tried this rangefinder. My Leopold targets flags immediately while this one requires constant searching. I just couldn’t trust my distances so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Zebrowski

customer_reviews.title: Has worked perfectly for 3.5 yrs so far
customer_reviews.text: OK, my kid just realized he lost it... I checked my orders on amazon to see when we bought it... 3.5 yrs ago. We probably play 30ish rounds a year? more if you include the local little 9 hole. This thing has worked perfectly the entire time. Double check w/ the fancy people in our group who paid double for whatever they have. Always the same measurements to the flag etc. Also, I am horrible at reading/following directions, and even I figured this out intuitively. I never write reviews, but figured I owed one on this one. If I call the last course we played and nobody turned it in, I will buy a new one asap.
customer_reviews.author: c Love

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay to start. Won't register distances beyond 110 ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay to start. Won't register distances beyond 110 or so yards. OR it picks up everything BEHIND the flag. Send me a new one, TecTecTec, and I'll give it a try. Other than that, I will pay the price and get a Bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a second rangefinder when my wife “borrowed” my Bushnell. Did a bunch of research and settled on the TecTecTec based on the combination of price and number of positive reviews on Amazon. While I find it a little harder to lock on to pins then the Bushnell. In windy conditions the Bushnell locks in quickly, the TecTecTec will pick up the pin but will also get the background. I have found the range to be very comparable to the Bushnell, typically within a couple of yards (compared to mine and others). Overall, a great value and recommended rangefinder.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Devoe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t compare to the high end range finders
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I should have figured that when I bought it. The guys I play with have a bushnell but in the other cart, so I wanted my own. Figured with the reviews, couldn’t be so bad. Wrong. This will be upwards of +-25 yards different than the Bushnell. Sometimes it seems to give accurate measurements, but that’s the thing, having distance doesn’t matter if it’s only right half the time. I should have been WAY more in tune with the return policy on this. Pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tucker

customer_reviews.title: TecTecTec VPRO500 rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: I caddy for a living on the west coast. As a result, there is almost always a marine layer. Unless the air was perfectly clear, I kept getting a distance reading of between “04-07”. Extremely frustrating! Also of note, the product is constructed with a ultra cheap feeling and looking plastic body that would definitely not be even slightly water resistant in a typical PNW raining season. I was persuaded to give this rangefinder a try by all the 4 and 5 star reviews and save a few bucks over the top brands in the process, but alas, back to paying for Bushnell quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Robin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this rangefinder. It has really good optics and is quite easy to use. It feels like quality when handled. It comes with a very nice case too. I use it for boating and not for golf. It allows me to know accurately if I am drifting backwards toward a rock when anchored, or if the boater in front of me has an anchor that is dragging. The follow up this company does to make sure I am satisfied with their product is extraordinary. Even messages in their packaging shows they want the buyer to be fully satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper41

customer_reviews.title: Quick results
customer_reviews.text: I have had the wrist watch type GPS devices and they last a year or two and then batteries die and you have to remember to recharge it after each round. Whenever my battery dies in the laser rangefinder it is replaceable! Also, I have had trouble holding other rangefinders steady enough on the pin to get a good result. With TecTec pin seeking feature, all I need do is wave it back and forth over the flag and tap it twice and it gives yardage to closest item in the field of view. So much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Charles S

customer_reviews.title: Nope, returning it, within the month time limit
customer_reviews.text: Readings varied too much, tried it enough to not count on the answer. I have a gps watch and some of the measurements of the Tec were the same as the gps watch, but if I take 5 readings, I don't know which is correct, and variation is way too much for me to have a quiz every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Higgins

customer_reviews.title: You deserve a jolt if you pay more
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I hesitated in buying a rangefinder, I mean after all, I just wanted to use at the practice range to see how far I was hitting my ball and I was'nt about to spend over $350. When I found TecTec VPRO500 and compared it to my golf buddies Bushnell, hell, he deserves it big JOLT for paying what he paid. We both continued to receive the same yardage and at times a1 yard difference. I'm all about customer service, and I received an email from Sara welcoming to the family and to please advise if I had any problems with the rangefinder. Now that's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Cannot find a better rangefinder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rangefinder back in May 2020 and have used it hundreds of times since. This is simply the best rangefinder you can buy. I am not the best golfer in the world, so I figured why pay $400+ for a rangefinder when I can buy this one that has over 4500 reviews and over 4 stars. I was also surprised (while playing a round of golf with a random person) that they had the exact same one and also loved it. I have compared this to my buddies HIGH DOLLAR "Brand Name" rangefinder and the distances have been spot on. So, with the money I saved on this rangefinder, I will play a few extra rounds of golf.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Burns

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. Super easy to use the flag mode. Just hold the button and swipe back and forth over the flag and it'll give you the reading quickly and easily. I've also compared it to my friends Garvin watches and bushnell range finders and it's dead on accurate. Haven't found anything to complain about yet. I've used it for about 6 rounds now. What also seems like really good customer service that cares about your opinion of their product.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a pretty heavy duty case which is awesome. Took a minute to figure out how to get an accurate reading but if you turn on the pinfinder(press mode and you'll see a little flag appear in bottom left) and hold down the button you can zero in on the pin, otherwise you might be getting the ground in front of the green or the trees behind. Got it for my husband as a gift. He's played for years without one but it's kinda nice to compare his guess at the distance with the actual distance and has helped choose which iron to use many times.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Nyman

customer_reviews.title: Tec Tec Tec is good.....Very good!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a range finder, I have always relied on a golf watch for distances to the green or the pin, but the watch is not that exact, and at times is way off. I decided to start shopping for a range finder and was inpressed with the reviews of Tec Tec Tec...so decided to pull the trigger, after a couple of rounds playing with the VPRO500 and getting to know it, my confidence grew with each shot. Customer support is awesome, they really care that you are satisfied with your purchase, and will bend over backward to help. 5 star rating!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary K. Lea

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Website description is spot on. I love the fact that it has a diopter as I have monovision contacts and this allows me to adjust for either eye. It is light and small enough to fit in my pocket. I use the scan and pinseeker modes for golf. Works great. Initially had some issues but after I contacted customer service they provided me with the solution. Very quick response as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mirror3

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but it has some shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Low Price 2. Easy to lock on pin 3. Light 4. Small Cons: 1. Yardage is displayed out of view - you have to tilt the unit slightly to see the yardage after you lock it in. Not sure why they made the cross hairs and yardage so large - smaller size and they could have fit everything in the view so that you don't have to tilt the unit. 2. The diopter is so loose that it you need to constantly adjust it. 3. Battery door is not watertight - just a sliding cover.
customer_reviews.author: WillJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this product. It registers the pin, but won't show the distance. I have changed batteries, reset it, etc., but nothing has helped. This product was a waste of money. If you're thinking of buying this product, I advise you to spend a little more money and get the Bushnell or Callaway range finder. I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Walker

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Tech - not accurate, difficult to find target.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and spend it on a better device. No one has 3 minutes on every shot to confirm the correct distance. this thing is all over the map. Also, the company claims that "just ok is not acceptable" and that they "want you to be happy" yet they are unwilling to refund your money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allen

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED - WARRANTY HONORED.  *****worked great.. until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I CONTACTED THE SELLER AND THEY PROMPTLY WORKED WITH ME TO REPLACE THE ITEM WITH A BRAND NEW ONE. UPGRADING TO 4 STARS... VERY EFFICIENT PROCESS VIA EMAIL. RESPONSES WERE RECEIVED SAME DAY. VERY MUCH APPRECIATED THE INTEGRITY AND THE PROFESSIONALISM. purchased in March 2019. Recently has stopped working. Changed batteries (twice). will still work at short distances... up to about 100 yards. Anyting further than that it does not show a distance... displays doted lines. ----
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to aim and very easy to read the yardage.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this model over less expensive ones primarily because of the many positive reviews. I can join the chorus of voices that say it seems to be very well constructed. It is very easy to aim and very easy to read the yardage. I would have bought a golf gps instead, but my wife has used them and the course is often incorrectly programmed. With this, you do not need to depend on software updates. My only irritation is that the battery is a little hard to install. I must have fussed with it for 5 minutes the first time before I was able to get it in.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Signor

customer_reviews.title: Great playing aid!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device, so much more versatile than the GPS app on my phone; I really like being able to measure distance not only to the flag, but to the lip of the bunker, or the tree at the corner of the dogleg, etc., etc. I can see this device actually helping me improve my strategic decisions, even on the most familiar courses. Note that my hands aren't very steady - I was never allowed to use the camcorder, for example! - but I'm still able to get a distance reading, thanks to the pinseeker mode.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Lovin it! Great deal for the $
customer_reviews.text: Had a Bushnell before. Expensive. Had to replace it and after reading the positive reviews on this TecTectec rangefinder I decided to take a chance and get one. Glad I did! Took a couple of times to get used to but am now loving it. Yardage is very accurate and that's all I need. And the price was fantastic. Great deal for the money. Have also dealt with the company about something and they certainly care about their customers. I would highly recommend this product as well as the people behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it !! I bought this to use as a supplement to my Bushnell GPS wrist watch. Hoped to use the pin-locker lengths in an upcoming tournament. The enclosed instructions are almost worthless. I found user supplied instruction and they were awesome. The device locks on the pin easily and really helped. I was able to get pin distance and barely looked at my wristwatch GPS. OH, and did I mention the price point? Why pay more?
customer_reviews.author: Donald Wilderotter

customer_reviews.title: Gives Wrong Distance
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder consistently gives the wrong distance. I thought it was user error, so I had other guys in my foursome use it and they got the wrong distance too. They used their rangefinders and got the correct distance. On multiple attempts I can get the correct distance. I have to use my GPS to check that the rangefinder is wrong or right. I still use it but it's a hassle to always verify.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Be wise and purchase a better brand - this one is reliable for a year or a little more.
customer_reviews.text: The rangefinder has a hard time picking up the target. Compared to the Nikon Coolshot, the quality of the rangefinder is lower. In addition, I am currently having issues with the display screen not reflecting the distance to the pin. I replaced the battery and it continues to have the issue. Never had this issue with the Nikon product. If you save $50 by purchasing this model, you will end up purchasing a new one in a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: DR M

customer_reviews.title: A Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck rangefinder. Accurate and easy to use. I also use the VPRO500 to help me with club distances. I will hit twenty or so balls at the driving range with let's say the 7-iron and then I set up my golf bag at the tee. I walk out to the grouping of balls and measure the closest, the middle and the furthest balls by sighting back to my golf bag and then I take the average for my 7-iron club distance.
customer_reviews.author: Dumbbunny

customer_reviews.title: So far, very good
customer_reviews.text: The features and picture are better than my old Bushnell, it's slightly smaller, and it appears a little less sturdy, but after two rounds... Likes: Mainly, the price (if the device lasts), 3 modes (not difficult to figure out despite reviews), crystal clear view, nice hard case, accurate yardages. Dislikes: Takes a good deep breath and a steady hand to lock in on a target. But is that bad before hitting a shot? Haven't had to deal with customer service because I've had no issues. Others rave about it. If this rangefinder performs like this for a few years I would call it a great value.
customer_reviews.author: words

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a little more than 2.5 years. Good while  it lasted?
customer_reviews.text: Used mainly for getting distances to hazards because it wasn't easy getting distances to pins/flags (at least for me). I use my GPS watch for distances to greens. I didn't use the rangefinder every round. Only when I needed to avoid or carry hazards. It was pretty good (while it lasted) when I did use it. What broke was the display. The numbers became hard to read (too light) . I thought it just needed a new battery, but replaced the battery right away and still had the same issue. I can't say I can recommend. I can't afford buying one every 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silvestre

customer_reviews.title: Never worked well
customer_reviews.text: Initially I could get an accurate distance with multiple tries. I would get numbers all over the board, but pick the one that seemed right. Eventually it quit even giving an accurate number at all. This was my second of three rangefinders. The first quit, this one never worked and the third is awesome. I would avoid.
customer_reviews.author: DCnTN

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: As I write this the range finder has been in my bag for several months and I must say every time I pulled it out to use it I was amazed, the ease of use the accuracy how it fit in the palm of my hand everything was just perfect. I read all the reviews prior to purchasing and found quite a few positives so I pulled the plug ordered, received and used happy ever since oh yeah and the cost was quite a few dollars less than some other range finders on the market, a good buy in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous customer service and a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's birthday. Initially he said he didn't need it because he has a golf watch with some special features on it. However I urged him to try it. He used it today for the first time and when he came home he gave me a big kiss and thanked me, saying he had his lowest score ever in 40+ years! He beat all the guys he was playing with and was just thrilled with this rangefinder. I also have to say that I have had unsolicited support from the company...they reached out to make sure I was satisfied with the product! How amazing is that nowadays?!!!
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Spend a minute on the manual for the mode button.
customer_reviews.text: Gives fast, accurate pin readings and is a quality instrument with a surprisingly low price. I think the occasional poor review may be due to unfamiliarity with the mode button. I was in that frame of mind until I read the little manual. The mode button is of little use to me so now I just make sure the mode I choose is the little flag view in the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Marenbear

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my teenage daughter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this range finder for my teenage daughter, who is a member of her high school varsity team. She is very pleased with how well it worked and believes it took strokes off her game. We found it to be very accurate, and have had no issue with the battery life - it is still working great after a full season of daily use. I also purchased the silicone case for added protection. My only wish is that I'd have purchased the model that also measures slope, since the courses we golf on are not flat. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 2 months...AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Got this range finder worked great for a couple months and then all of a sudden couldn’t get a reading past 120 yards. Got a replacement sent via warranty and the same thing happened to the replacement. Don’t waste your money or have to deal with the headache of contacting customer service every 8 weeks when the unit will stop working. I am currently waiting for my THIRD unit to be sent to me and regret buying a cheap range finder without doing more research. ALSO HAD TO PAY ALL SHIPPING COSTS FOR THE REPLACEMENT UNITS.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Prokopenko

customer_reviews.title: It’s accurate and so easy to use. I loves it, and the belt attached case is easy to open.
customer_reviews.text: This range finder is so easy to use. My wife bought this range finder for a Christmas present. I was thrilled, but a little nervous because I am not that technical. Being I live in Chicago and was 26 below actual temp, I did not have a chance to use it. However I just got to Gulf shores Alabama and just go done playing golf. What a pleasure it was to use this range finder, so easy to use and I now have no excuse. Just aim and you get the yardage, I just wish I could hit it straight, but I now can get the yardage. It’s great.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: A very good range finder that covers all your needs.
customer_reviews.text: As a new golfer this range finder has been a great help to me in determining what the distances are from my current location to the hole. And with that exact (I'm terrible at guessing distances) knowledge it is much easier to make a proper club selection. I found this range finder extremely easy to use within 5 minutes of opening the box. After having researched all the top brands at nearly twice the price it was an easy choice. This one has all the features most any golfer will need. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoBill

customer_reviews.title: Very Dim after 6 months, Can not read the Yardage.
customer_reviews.text: Very Dim after 6 months, Can not read the numbers. Replaced Battery, the same. I sent email, they recommended put mine in the car dashboard. I did it but the same. I am not using it any more. I download paid app from android that works better. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after four months but factory replaced it free in one week
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for four months then failed to range anything over about fifty yards. Close is fine but anything over 50-60 yards will not register...target shows sunburst pattern and five dashes without number of yards or meters. Very disappointed with this as I really liked using it. Contacted the factory, they suggested some steps that didn't work; I returned the unit and they shipped a replacement the next day.
customer_reviews.author: R. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Very so-so product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but after having a Leupold for several years, this is just lacking in quality of material and image. So while it may be a bargain price-wise, if you're an avid golfer you're better off paying the extra for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: DHC90024

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a watch style range finder that is awesome...when it works and I don’t press a wrong button that sends me off into frustration land trying to return to where I need to be. The laser rangefinder doesn’t need to be charged between uses. This unit is easy to use. Just point at something and when the indicators show that it has locked on, release the button and read the distance. Not sure what the expensive Bushnell’s do better (better optics?) but this unit is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Linz92

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I lost my Bushnell range finder earlier this year and couldn't stomach another $300 purchase. I decided to take a chance on a much less expensive rangefinder and to my surprise, this one is just as good if not better. It doesn't have the same "jolt" when you hit the flag, but rather when you hold the button down, it continuously scans targets and the number updates realtime. So just hold the button and scan over the stick. It works perfectly and I highly recommend saving your money and buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a few years now and have never once been able to lock on cleanly to the flag. distances are always off I end up having aim at the ground near my target. Always off by at least 5 meters. I just end up using my gold app ups. Smh sadly I'm very disappointed in this product also the zoom focus adjuster fell off the glue was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Klove

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of Bushnell, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. Battery included, worked immediately out of the box. (I can tell you the neighbor's chimney is 54 yeards away from my living room). Used all summer on the golf course, had no problems with shooting the flag, readings always within 1-2 yards of playing partner's Bushnell rangefinder, more accurate than GPS watches. Even in flagstick mode, I found it easier to shoot the flag itself rather than just sweep the stick as I am a little shakey holding it still.
customer_reviews.author: DocDenis

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk one day just stopped working. No drops, no damage. Not even 7 full months of use (I play most weekends). Very upset, since the price of this thing is up there. Skip this brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Worst Rangefinder I have ever bought..
customer_reviews.text: The product is only weeks old. It is proven very difficult to lock the flag, to the point that it is hard to trust it because it often locks a target behind the flag. But the worst is the with a light mist yesterday, the rangefinder got humidity inside and it is totally blurred (pics attached), unsusable. It was a definte waste of money. I use this product in Panama and I have no way to return it. I 100% regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Not all rangefinders are the same
customer_reviews.text: hard to use compared to the others i have had.. difficult to lock on to pins... spend the money on the real finders NOT THIS ONE...
customer_reviews.author: Carmen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: HAve been wanting to buy a rangefinder for the last couple of seasons, but couldnt let myself pay the high prices i was seeing. While on Amazon I came across the TecTecTec VPRO500 and for the price and advertised features I gave it a shot. Boy am I glad I did. Great construction, features, and of course price! I have not been let down at all as I started to use it. Fits nicely in the pocket of my golf bag, making it more accessible and more likely I'll use it. Extremely accurate. The construction is top-notch and I'm glad I waited before spending way more money to get the same quality and features. Great product, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Shanahan, III

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder & price
customer_reviews.text: I have had other more expensive range finders in the past. This product beats them all. Easy to use. Accurate. Stable. I don't want all the extraneous information like slope, club recommendation, etc. I just want to shoot the flag or other objects like bunkers and know the yardage. Display is sharp and clear. I could not be more satisfied and would recommend this TecTecTec to anyone. Why pay hundreds of dollars when this one works great at a fraction of the cost of other "name" devices. I'm a 4 handicap and this product is all I need. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever range finder purchased, but I have used it for 5 rounds thus far and haven't had any issues except the day I played in 45-50mph wind gusts in a tournament. That day it had a bit of trouble picking up the pin, but it was more to do with being steady vs. The machine's abilities. I haven't had any issues with it, it has been 1yd Max different than either a bushnell or leupold that the other teams had, or playing partners. I also, have had very quick responses from the customer service/management teams at Tectectec. Hope it helps someone, also for 1/2 the price of a bushnell, you couldn't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Why pay much more when the quality and accuracy meet every need?
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder works great for what I wanted it for. I bought the protective cover and the two together are perfect! I use both at the driving range and on the course. It locks easily on the flagstick and on other objects that I point out to determine their distance to me. Mine does not have slope but I often play with others that do and I have gotten good at adjusting for the slope based on the elevations. I highly recommend the TecTecTecvPro 500 because for the cost and compactness, it is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: johnthomasc3

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working over 150 yards after the second use. Feels cheap when you hold it like a plastic toy. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Antillon

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what the expensive ones do - why pay twice as much??
customer_reviews.text: I used it last weekend - loved it!! It is small, light and easy to use. Clear picture of the target or hazard with exact yardage. I believe the most important yardage number is the CARRY distance you have with different clubs. This VPRO500 gives you the yardage distance so you can select the correct club to clear a hazard and have a nice 2nd shot or be on the green. I wore the case on my belt so I had the VPRO500 with me all the time. Light weight and case closed/opened easily with a half zipped effort. This does exactly what the range finders do the cost 2 time more. Da !!!!
customer_reviews.author: bogotaone

customer_reviews.title: Really Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I've used my TecTecTec Golf Rangefinder for several weeks now, and I must say it is easy to use and as accurate as any other unit I've used. I have Parkinson's so I was a bit concerned initially that my "shakiness" might cause problems with obtaining an accurate reading. This has not been an issue for me with the TecTecTec unit, so I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Beales

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mom. She couldn't figure out how to get a consistent lock on a pin and gave it back to me in frustration. I couldn't figure out how to make it work consistently either. Since I bought it a couple weeks before Christmas and she didn't have a chance to try it out for a couple weeks, we missed the return window. I expressed my dissatisfaction with the manufacturer and got a complicated set of troubleshooting instructions in response. I wish I wouldn't have gambled on a cheap product and just got a Bushnell instead.
customer_reviews.author: J McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as much more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to good to be true that this could be as good as the expensive ones at half the price. But, it works as well as the Bushnells, and is "point and shoot" easy to use. I had been using my GPS app for range finding before, and it's generally really good, but it's been surprising to compare the two, this one is much more accurate, and sometimes my GPS was off by 10-15 yards, a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Dave J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad, real bad
customer_reviews.text: I damaged my Bushnell and bought this. I don't know how it gets all the positive reviews or mine was a dog. It is all over the place range wise and won't lock-in. Going back to Bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: JMarr

customer_reviews.title: Takes the place of rangefinder watch!
customer_reviews.text: Although it is April 3 and I live in Vermont where there is still snow on the ground I was able to practice with my new rangefinder using other targets than those found on the golf course. I found it easier to use the written instructions then the video to get started. The video is pretty fast and I was able to go at my own speed using the written instructions. Our course has undergone a massive reconstruction in the past 8 months and using the rangefinder watch I own will no longer work. This should take care of the problem because of the fact that it is simple and light. Miles Heller Essex Junction, VT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great... Finds the pin easily.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rangefinder to replace my lost CaddyTek (which I LOVED, but wasn't available direct through Amazon and I didn't want to work). Finds the pin. Simple concept of returning the closest yardage when scanning. not sure why all don't work like this. returned two other cheaper models, each of which had the vibrate feature... they just didn't work. Buzzed randomly. I recommend this one. Compared to CaddyTek, perhaps a bit heavier and a tighter button, but this unit is more than fine.
customer_reviews.author: gpcnyc

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price and great item to own
customer_reviews.text: I have been thinking of purchasing a ranger finder for some time but did not like the expense of many of them. Then I heard about the VPRO500. After checking out the reviews, I made the purchase. Already I find it easy to use, accurate, and well-made. The various modes are a nice feature as well. The pin sensor mode is especially nice to use. Great product. Great price. How did I play golf without this??
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: Cannot rely on this
customer_reviews.text: I'm a former collegiate golfer and feel more confident walking out my yardage using yardage markers than using this rangefinder. It isn't accurate and for the most part, I've had to just leave in my bag. Looking at other options like the Precision Pro or Bushnell.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lin

customer_reviews.title: TecTecTec came through
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TecTecTec VPro500 to be able to obtain accurate yardage and help my game. It is an outstanding value and worked right out of the gate. Unfortunately the unit malfunctioned however Isabella M from TecTecTec took care of me. Companies can appear great if the services and products work as promised but the true test of customer service is how they take care of you when things don't go so well. Excellent customer service, highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Baick

customer_reviews.title: Decent rangfinder
customer_reviews.text: So needed a back up to my golf watch as my watch died during a tourney one day and didn't have any to gage distance other than sprinkler heads..Not Again!! Read reviews of other and bought this one. Worked great. Easy to use, and seemed to be as accurate as can be. I would recommend this over similar types that cost more.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding range finder
customer_reviews.text: I've played 2 rounds with the range finder and have found that the 6x zoom is a huge help compared to my old device (which was a bit dated). The ability to scan for the pin helps tremendously to narrow in on your target and has proven to be incredibly accurate. Using the simple point/shoot mode is also great for getting distances to hazards and other objects. The instructions were very clear, concise, and accurate. The price is outstanding for the value and features it delivers. I'm incredibly happy with it - now just need the game to go with it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Dolby

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 3 years ago didn't use it a lot. Pulled it out to use a few weeks ago and you can't read the distances anymore. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and function
customer_reviews.text: At about 1/2 the price of the major brands this is a real bargain. It works by just pressing and releasing a button. It is highly accurate so you can measure the front of a hazard...like clearing the sand or a lake. You need to be sure the little aiming box is on your actual target or you will not get the reading you are looking for. I also bought the neon green protective cover so I don't leave this one in the cart like I did with my previous rangefinder.
customer_reviews.author: Tulbox

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this VPOR500 within the last month. The accuracy is concerning. I have to take at least 3 readings to assure myself I have the right distance. I have it set on Pinsensor but can get 100 yd differences on a reading. The range finder must be targeting different thing each time. I am careful to hold the range finder on the pin during targeting. I'm disappointed. Had a Bushnell before that I didn't have any problem with until it quite. Jack Kinsella
customer_reviews.author: John R. Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: Good Product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews of various golf range finders, I purchased the Tec Tec Tec VPRO500 based on high ratings and good value. I tried it out last week with my foursome. One of the guys in our group has a Bushnell's Tour V4 Shift rangefinder, which cost much more than the VPRO500. We compared results from various distances, and never was there any significant distance variations between the 2 units. I'm satisfied at this point with my purchase of the VPRO500
customer_reviews.author: CMR

customer_reviews.title: Really like this. Does the job for me.
customer_reviews.text: Average Joe golfer. Wanted to get introduced to range finder without investing a lot of $$$. Used this several times and it can pin point flag distance as well as any other objects in view. It does not have slope but for my game it probably doesn't matter. I use this and U Swing golf app. Probably going to get a GPS golf watch next to see how that works. IT also comes with a nice case which I hang of my bag.
customer_reviews.author: nickman999

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought it new in April 2017, worked great with no problems. In July 2018 the focusing lens dislodged inside the eye viewer. Even though it was our is the warranty period I contacted TecTecTec for repair. They sent me a new rangefinder free of charge. I highly recommend this product, the company stands behind its product and they have excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: RMC

customer_reviews.title: it is looking like a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He has not had a chance to use it since it is winter here. He has examined it and practiced with it and is very impressed. A particular thing he noticed was that it held steady when holding it up to his eye. Others he had looked at were not that way, and would wobble or move when he was homing in on the flag. So far, it is looking like a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Benton

customer_reviews.title: Good golf aid
customer_reviews.text: Range finder works well. I particularly like the flag finding feature. I also like the color viewing. Used it twice now and found it easy to use and it is very light. No complaints. I have been using this range finder now for a year or more. I love it. I use it in conjunction with my gps watch. The range finder can locate distance to hazards not always marked that my watch can’t locate. I really like the flag distance location. Just turn on that mode and swiped the crosshairs across the flag an immediately get the distance. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Don N

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great price, accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made, compact and easy to use rangefinder. I used it on the day it arrived. I quickly read the instructions and shot a couple distances off the back deck to familiarize myself with the process. Easy peezy. While playing, easily locked in on pins (our course has many trees around the greens but was able to get true and accurate measurements to the PIN and not the trees). It does exactly as I had hoped it would do. The best part...the price. My golf buddies have Bushnell rangefinders that costs at least twice what this rangefinder costs. Guess what? Their measured distances were exactly the same as mine, although theirs was not as fast.
customer_reviews.author: JB37312

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder worked perfectly for about one whole week. Then when I attempted to call customer service I got no response after three attempts. I also emailed and got no response. I’m not even sure if they are still in business or if they just have the worst customer service I’ve ever witnessed
customer_reviews.author: chris george

customer_reviews.title: A Real Bargain...Buy One!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a good laser rangefinder at a great price, this is The One! Fast, accurate, a quality product. Doesn't quite lock on to the flagstick as well as my former Bushnell Pinseeker w/Slope, but I can buy 3 VPRO500s for the same price. Also, my Bushnell's laser lost its alignment and Bushnell wanted more than the price of my new VPRO500s to repair it. Very pleased with this purchase, no more Bushnell products for me. Buy one, you'll be happy and be able to afford a lot of nice rounds with the savings.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for a low Price
customer_reviews.text: It is a great range finder. It is fairly accurate and the slope feature works very well. I tried it out in Hawaii on a course with a lot of elevated greens and found the slope to be very accurate. It does take some work to get familiar with it if you've never used a range finder before; I find that aiming at the stick or the flag often helps if it is windy or you're having a hard time keeping the device still.
customer_reviews.author: GQNUMB21

customer_reviews.title: Luxury item at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son's birthday as he is an avid golfer. After the first time he used them he came home and said these were the best thing he ever had besides his clubs and shoes. He wished he had asked for these sooner. And he said he felt like the Pros do. Functional, easy to carry on your club bag and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Heidinger

customer_reviews.title: Finding the flag is difficult.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product 8 months. When I first got it. I would shoot well on 90% of the flags I shot. Then about 3 months ago it stopped finding flags on almost 80%. I bought a new battery hopeing that this was a low battery issue. Not the case. It has totally stopped finding flags. It finds the trees behind the flag but that doesnt help. Don't buy one of these. know I cant return, and it doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Craincon

customer_reviews.title: This Range Finder is A*W*E*S*O*M*E ! ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: This range finder does everything you want it to do and more. The price doesn't hurt either...$149.99. I have another Range Finder from a different manufacturer (N*k*n Cool Shot) which I paid almost $400. I would take the Tec Tec Tec VPRO500 over the competition any day. This is how much I love this product...If I had a choice of getting ANY Range Finder FREE, or paying $150.00 for the Tec Tec Tec (Any model). I would spend the money with Tec Tec Tec without thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: great range finder. I use this for hunting in the fall and winter and during the spring, summer and fall for golf and this is up there with the $400.00+ range finders. I would rate a full 5 stars if it have an option to turn the crosshairs from black to green or even red. Other than it is a great purchase and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: BP

product_meta.title: TecTecTec VPRO500 Golf Rangefinder - Laser Range Finder with Pinsensor - Laser Binoculars - with Battery
feature_bullets: PREMIUM LASER RANGEFINDER; The VPRO500 Golf Laser Rangefinder is a premium product, measuring up to 540 yards with continuous scan mode, advanced Pin-Seeker technology, and a durable rainproof body.

ADVANCED PIN-SEEKER TECHNOLOGY; Provides fast measurement with +/- 1 yard accuracy, together with Pin-Seeker technology to accurately measure overlapping subjects, perfect for measuring golf flags, hazards and wooded areas.

THROUGH THE LENS DISPLAY; Premium, ultra-clear, multi-layered optics with easy read, through the lens display with distance and low battery indicator, and continuous measurement mode for fast and convenient measurements.

LIGHTWEIGHT, PORTABLE AND DURABLE; Measures just 4.09 x 2.83 x 1.61 inches and weighing just 6.52 oz with a rain resistant, durable body, perfect for carrying while golfing or hunting or for measuring and surveying without extra weight or bulk. High-quality 6x monocular lens with multi-layer coating for bright clear images.

FULL PACKAGE; Complete rangefinder package for quick setup, including premium carrying pouch, CR2 battery, wrist strap, microfiber cleaning cloth, quick start guide, TecTecTec Happiness Guarantee for 2 Years (Online Registration Required) and Lifetime Customer Support. That's what we call a full package!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
